body.p: To his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners John. W. Bingham and Nimrod Harris would respectfully represent to your Excellency that one Lafe Marshall was fined in the Police Court of Harrodsburg the sum of five Dollars and cost, amounting in all to the sum of Nine Dollars and 35 cents; and that an execution was issued against the said Marshall, and was replevied by your petitioners, Since the execution of said bond, the said Marshall has left the state of Kentucky, and your petitioners are informed, he is now in the Southern now in the Army. That an execution has issued upon said bond against your petitioners for said fine and cost, and is now in the hands of the Marshal -- and that your petitioners will have to pay the same, and that they have no funds in their hands belonging to the said Marshall; and should your petitioners pay the same, it will be a total loss to them.

Wherefore your petitioners would pray your Excellency to intepose in
their behalf, and remit said fine: and as in duty bound we will ever pray.
John WB Bingham and Nimrod Harris say that the statements contained in the foregoing petition are true --
Sworn to before me this the 18 day Nov 1861.
E. J. Polk Examiner for Mercer County
We the undersigned Citizens of Harrodsburg join in the prayer of the foregoing petition --
